alert.note: Alert for Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 14 at 6:14PM MST until August 14 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 715 PM MST. * At 614 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 7 miles east of Florence to 13 miles southwest of Chui-Chu, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 206 and 231. Route 77 between mile markers 89 and 96. Route 79 between mile markers 92 and 128. Route 87 between mile markers 116 and 124. Route 177 between mile markers 139 and 158. Locations impacted include... Eloy, Saddlebrooke, Kearny, Picacho, Chui-Chu, Picacho Peak State Park, Red Rock, Cactus Forest, Cockleburr, North Komelik, Kohatk, Jack Rabbit, Shopishk, Kelvin, Oracle Junction and East Chui-Chu. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
